terms.definition: A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or files over time, allowing users to access previous versions and prevent conflicts when multiple people edit the same document.
A single, unified location where all documents, files, or data are stored and managed, providing easy access and organization for teams.
A software system that uses artificial intelligence to automate, organize, and enhance the creation and management of documentation.
The ability for multiple users to simultaneously edit, comment on, and work together on documents with changes visible instantly to all participants.
Security features that restrict user permissions and document access based on their job role or responsibilities within an organization.
Pre-programmed sequences of tasks and approvals that execute automatically based on specific triggers or conditions, reducing manual intervention.
Software and services that are hosted on remote servers and accessed via the internet, rather than installed locally on individual computers.
A chronological record of all changes, access, and activities performed on documents or systems, used for compliance and accountability purposes.
A comprehensive collection of all related documents and information about a specific product, project, or regulatory submission.
Official records and paperwork required to demonstrate adherence to industry regulations, legal standards, and safety requirements.
A detailed compilation of technical documents, specifications, and data that supports product development, regulatory approval, or compliance requirements.
Software as a Service - a cloud computing model where software applications are provided over the internet on a subscription basis.
Application Programming Interface - a set of protocols and tools that allows different software applications to communicate and share data with each other.
A centralized digital library of information, articles, and resources that provides self-service support and answers to common questions.
Software that stores, organizes, tracks, and controls electronic documents and images, often including features like search, security, and workflow automation.
